Description: From 5/1, permitted 25% occupancy for certain retail/dining/movie theaters/malls and set minimum health protocols.
Primary Mobility Impact: Gradual resumption of discretionary trips under capacity and mitigation rules.

Description: In response to rising cases/hospitalizations, closed bars to on-premise service, reduced restaurant capacity to 50%, and curtailed large outdoor events.
Primary Mobility Impact: Nightlife/weekend leisure travel dropped sharply; cross-city recreation suppressed.

Description: Mandated face coverings in most public settings; empowered local officials to restrict outdoor gatherings >10.
Primary Mobility Impact: Reduced risk in transit/indoor commercial settings; curbed large events.

Description: Allowed many sectors to operate at 75% occupancy in regions with low COVID-19 hospitalizations.
Primary Mobility Impact: Further recovery of commuting/consumer mobility, contingent on regional metrics.

Description: County judges could allow bars to reopen at 50% capacity with distancing and other protocols.
Primary Mobility Impact: Nightlife/weekend travel rebounded in opt-in areas but under caps and controls.
